events.event_description: U.S. wholesale propane prices reached $0.97/gal for the week ending January 20, 2025, higher than the previous year's price of $0.79/gal.
events.citation: For the week ending January 20, 2025, U.S. wholesale propane prices were $0.97/gal, slightly higher than at this time last year when they were $0.79/gal.

events.event_description: The United States achieved record propane exports in 2024, averaging 1.8 million barrels per day, representing a 9% increase from 2023.
events.citation: The United States is exporting record amounts of propane, averaging 1.8 million barrels per day in 2024, a 9% increase compared with 2023 and the highest weekly average on record.

events.event_description: U.S. retail propane prices increased 5% from the start of the winter heating season to December 30, 2024.
events.citation: U.S. average retail propane prices have increased 5% from the beginning of this winter heating season to the week ending December 30, 2024.

events.event_description: December 2024 recorded more heating degree days than December 2023, indicating colder temperatures and higher heating needs.
events.citation: December 2024 had more heating degree days than December 2023, and we expect more of them throughout this winter compared with last winter, according to our December Short-Term Energy Outlook.
